summary: The "Find It Early Act" aims to provide expanded access to breast cancer screening and diagnostic imaging without cost-sharing. It mandates coverage by group health plans, Medicare, Medicaid, TRICARE, and the Department of Veterans Affairs for individuals at increased risk or with specific breast tissue density, and for those recommended by healthcare providers based on risk factors. The bill outlines specific amendments to various sections of the Public Health Service Act, Social Security Act, United States Code, and United States Code Title 38 to achieve these goals, with an effective date of January 1, 2026.
